ext_descriptions.ext_description: A horizontal_justification lists the types of the horizontal justification.
specifies that type of the horizontal justification is right;
specifies that type of the horizontal justification is centre;
specifies that type of the horizontal justification is left;
A message_content specifies a text message.
A stratum_surface_designation lists the types of stratum surface.
specifies that stratum surface is primary;
specifies that stratum surface is secondary;
A vertical_justification lists the types of the vertical justification.
specifies that type of the vertical justification is centre;
specifies that type of the vertical justification is top;
specifies that type of the vertical justification is bottom;
A Stratum_concept_relationship is a or a .
the resulting_shape specifies the role of the for the Stratum_concept_relationship. The resulting_shape need not be specified for a particular Stratum_concept_relationship.

A Stratum_average_surface specifies the constructed geometry that is the average of the primary and secondary surface for a . A Stratum_average_surface is provided as a construction aid in defining a .
an of_stratum specifies the role of a for a Stratum_average_surface.

ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
ext_description.p: A Stratum_surface specifies the primary_surface or secondary_surface for a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the name designates a primary_surface or a secondary_surface for a Stratum_surface.
an of_stratum specifies the for a Stratum_surface.
The combination of name and of_stratum shall be unique within a population of Stratum_surface.

An Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition is a link in a sequence of stratum surfaces that result in the completed design. This link is not to another but is instead to a surface of an Embedded_component. There may be multiple Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition that reference the same stratum surface in the case where are laterally adjacent. The use of Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition in combination with the position in 2D space of the Embedded_component within the interconnect is sufficient to uniquely identify the 3D location of the Embedded_component.
the subsequent_item specifies the previous or the for the Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition.
the precedent_item specifies the previous or the for the Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition.
the name specifies the string for the human-interpretable identifier for the Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition.
The type of the precedent_item shall not be the same type as that of the subsequent_item.
The precedent_item shall not be the subsequent_item.
If the type of the precedent_item is a then the type of the precedent_item.definition is either or .
If the type of the subsequent_item is a then the type of the precedent_item.definition is either or .
The name shall be unique with a population of Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition.
The combination of the precedent_item and the subsequent_item shall be unique within a population of Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition.

ext_description.p: A Physical_laminate_component is a type of and a type of . The Physical_laminate_component supports the specification of a as a or for the purpose of estabishing a Datum_reference_frame for tolerance specification. A Physical_laminate_component shall be in a complex instance with another member of the subtype tree of and . The interpretation shall be in compliance with the interpretation as if Physical_laminate_component were Abstract.
ext_description.note: ISO 10303-11 does not permit Physical_laminate_component to be Abstract. Therefore this requirement is encoded in a rule.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Interconnect_module_join_terminal is a type of .

the defining_terminal is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Interconnect_module_join_terminal is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Interconnect_module_join_terminal as its .

ext_description.note: This description is incomplete.................
ext_description.p: A Probe_access_area is a type of . A Probe_access_area may be an . A Probe_access_area is a feature incorporated into the design of an for the purpose of measuring electrical characteristics of the design. It is realized by an area of conducting material that is helping to compose the or upon which the measurement is to be made. The Probe_access_area specifies the which it helps to compose.
ext_description.example: Figure illustrates a detail of a layout drawing that shows a probe area in the layout. Sufficient detail may be included in the design to evaluate accurately probe placement and volume restrictions.
A Probe_access_area may be a small metalization area placed inside a larger metalization feature such as a that may not be physically visible except for associated soldermask clearance.
ext_description.note: The geometry of the Probe_access_area is provided by the or by the .

A Probe_access_area generated directly from CAD data may not reference the final plating finish since some CAD systems do not have built-in models of the final finish. In this case, the error in the height approximation would have to be taken into account in the receiving system or eliminated by another application that added the final finish data.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the network is an inverse relationship that specifies that the Probe_access_area is existence dependent on the in the role of the for the Probe_access_area.
the probe_contact_zone specifies the role of the for the Probe_access_area.

ext_description.p: An Internal_probe_access_area is a type of included in the design for access to internal conductors for probing purposes.
ext_description.note: The stratum_feature_implementation inherited from the specifies the role of the for the Internal_probe_access_area. This is included only to support the probe requirements and is not necessarily included in a functional nodelist.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the internal_access is an inverse relationship that specifies that the Internal_probe_access_area is existence dependent on the the for which the Internal_probe_access_area is in the role of connected_probe.

An Internal_stratum_access is a relationship between an and a that provides access to a on an internal . This Application Object is part of a logical structure to identify the special usage of a Via in support of accessing internal conductors in the design.

the inter_stratum_feature specifies the that provides electrical connectivity to the to be probed for the Internal_stratum_access. The external surface of the is the area the test probe mates with in a test setup.
the connected_probe specifies the that provides probe access to a on an internal for the Internal_stratum_access.
The combination of the connected_probe and the inter_stratum_feature shall be unique within a population of Internal_stratum_accesses.

ext_description.p: A Generic_physical_network may be a . A Generic_physical_network is the result of mapping a topological definition of a physical connectivity requirement onto the conducting of an . The vertices, specified by , are mapped onto on the surface of one or more conducting in the . The design features that are implementing the Generic_physical_network are accessed by traversing the structure specified by the interconnect_module_net_topology_element attribute. The Generic_physical_network shall not implement direct connections to specified by , or , but shall implement connections only to Component_terminals in the scope of the design view being implemented. This Generic_physical_network implements connectivity to the join terminals of the components that are interface components in this , which is a design view. The scope of the Generic_physical_network is entirely within the interconnect design view and provides no information about assembly connectivity of design views within which occurrences of the , as may appear. The Generic_physical_network shall not use as connectivity_requirement_element terminals of or that are supporting internal implementation of the Generic_physical_network. Only or types that have interface_terminals shall be referenced. It is the decision of pre-processors whether to consider a associated with a to be in parallel with the current flow in an electrical scenario. That decision shall be represented by including the and the both in the external interface of the interconnect by means of the application of the to each individually. In the case that a pre-processor decides to ignore the current flow through the , the shall not be referenced by a member of .
ext_description.note:
The application object is provided so that traceability of the required connectivity for an assembly design view to that implemented internally in an may be supported. The application object is provided to specify explicitly the external terminals of the interconnect substrate that are to be connected. In a case where a design organization re-uses an interconnect design, the , since it is the actual connection statement for an , defines the capabilities of the interconnect substrate to satisfy the requirements imposed by the object. There may be many sets of
(one set per assembly design) that reference an interconnect substrate. There is only one set of for an interconnect substrate.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the connectivity_requirement_element specifies the to be connected by the network described by the . There shall be two or more for a . The specified by connectivity_requirement_element is one of the following: , , , , .
the prior_associated_definition specifies one or more that are definitions for prior versions of the design. The prior_associated_definition need not be provided.
the current_associated_definition specifies the that is the current product definition associated with the .
the name identifies the .
If the prior_associated_definition exists, then each member of prior_associated_definition shall not be the current_associated_definition.

ext_description.p: If the connectivity_requirement_element is a , then it shall be associated only with a or with a or with a .
ext_description.note: The critical aspect is that the itself is in the role of an external interface for the interconnect and that there are conductive elements connected to it on the same that implement the connectivity requirements of the . The fact that the land is also dependent on a Via or a is secondary to this rule. The Via implements the connectivity requirement and would be related to a referenced by the interconnect_module_network_topology_element attribute. The would be in parallel with the and would therefore also be included in the external interface for the purposes of the . It is the decision of pre-processors whether to consider a associated with a to be in parallel with the current flow in an electrical scenario.

ext_description.p:
If the connectivity_requirement_element is a , then it shall be associated only with a
or with a .
ext_description.note:
The critical aspect is that the itself is in the role of an external interface for the interconnect, and there are no other conductive elements on the same directly connected to the for the purpose of implementing the connectivity of the .
The connectivity required by the is supported as follows: The associated Via implements a ; The associated implements an external interface in parallel with the .

ext_description.p: Each that participates in the shall be classified identically in at least one of the electrical, thermal, optical conductivity property classification.
ext_description.example: Each for nominal circuitry using copper shall be classified as electrically conductive

ext_description.p: If an electrical, thermal, or optical conductivity property classification classifies a member of that participates in the , then all other members of that participate in the shall also be classified by a classification of the same type.
ext_description.example: An electrical conductivity property classification of 'conductive' for the referenced by a that helps implements a . All other Conductors that implement that shall reference that has an electrical conductivity property classification. In accordance with other rules, it would be expected that all Conductors would reference that was classified as 'conductive'.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: Each member of in the role of connectivity_requirement_element and each member of in the role of interconnect_module_network_topology_element referenced by shall be in the same design view.
All members of connectivity_requirement_element and interconnect_module_network_topology_element shall be in the current_associated_definition.
If the prior_associated_definition exists, then all members of connectivity_requirement_element and interconnect_module_network_topology_element shall be in the prior_associated_definition.
The name shall be unique within a population of Physical_networks in the context of the current_associated_definition.

A Routed_physical_network is a type of . A Routed_physical_network is a description of an incompletely specified mapping from requirements to layout. The set of unrouted elements shall be a subset of the total requirement set.
the unrouted_connectivity_requirement_element specifies the that are not yet implemented by circuitry for the . There shall be two or more for a .

ext_description.p: A Stratum_feature is a type of . A Stratum_feature may be either a or a , or additionally may be a . A Stratum_feature is a shape realized in the material of the .
ext_description.example: Figure illustrates several types of Stratum_feature. The Conductors shown are purposely distorted in aspect ratio because Conductors are enclosed shapes.

ext_description.p: the feature_of_size specifies whether or not the Stratum_feature interfaces with a feature of another product in an assembly context. A value of TRUE indicates that the Stratum_feature interfaces with a feature of another product. A value of FALSE indicates that the Stratum_feature does not interface with a feature of another product.
ext_description.note: Certain tolerance information depends on knowledge of a particular feature interfacing with features of a mating product.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the resident_stratum specifies the being composed by the Stratum_feature.
The combination of the name and the resident_stratum shall be unique within a population of Stratum_features.

A Fiducial_stratum_feature is a type of that is a basis of measurement with respect to other Stratum_features. A Fiducial_stratum_feature is used for accurate alignment of one item with another. Another type of may play the role of Fiducial_stratum_feature in a design.

ext_description.p: A Conductor is a type of realized in a that participates in the implementation of a .
ext_description.example: Figure illustrates a detail of a layout drawing that shows the Conductor in relationship to a component at the next level of the assembly.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the implementation_requirement specifies the that is used to constrain the Conductor by specifying the that are to be connected by the Conductor.
the resident_stratum inherited from the shall be redeclared as for the Conductor.
A Connected_filled_area is a type of . The Connected_filled_area is a with which a set of layer connection points are associated (as specified in the implementation_requirement attribute).
the implementation_requirement specifies the for which the Connected_filled_area is generated.
the resident_stratum inherited from the shall be redeclared as the for the Connected_filled_area.
A Conductive_filled_area is a type of in which the material is conductive. A Conductive_filled_area may be a .
A Layout_junction may be referenced by an to help define partial routing of a layout.
the location specifies the relative to the origin of the at which the Layout_junction resides.
the net specifies the for the Layout_junction. The net specifies the scope for identification of the Layout_junction, and for location identification.
the name specifies the string for identification of the Layout_junction within a .
the associated_definition specifies the for the Layout_junction. The associated_definition is the scope of the of the Layout_junction.
The associated_definition shall be the current_associated_definition of the net.
The combination of location, and net shall be unique within a population of Layout_junction.
The combination of name , and net shall be unique within a population of Layout_junction.

ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
ext_description.p: An Unrouted_join_relationship is a type of , in which the terminals referenced, , have not been converted into another type of . An Unrouted_join_relationship is an identification of items that are unrouted in a .

ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
ext_description.p: A Stratum_specific_part_template_location_in_padstack_definition is a type of . A Stratum_specific_part_template_location_in_padstack_definition binds a specific to a while locating the template in the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Passage_padstack_definition is a type of that references a specific .
an technology_references specifies the role of the for the Passage_padstack_definition.

ext_description.p: A Component_termination_passage_template is a type of . The Component_termination_passage_template defines all shape data for the associated (for which it is the usage_definition), and also where the connection (dependency) on passage technology is established for the properties.
ext_description.note: Properties other than shape are to be found in the of_passage_technology.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the access_mechanisms is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Component_termination_passage_template is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Component_termination_passage_template as its . There shall be two or more Component_termination_passage_template_terminals for a Component_termination_passage_template.
the of_passage_technology inherited from the shall be redeclared to be for the Component_termination_passage_template.
A Component_termination_passage_template_interface_terminal is a type of , an occurrence of which provides an interface capability to the next level of assembly.
A Component_termination_passage_template_terminal is a type of . A Component_termination_passage_template_terminal is one of a or a .

the terminal_shape is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Component_termination_passage_template_terminal is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Component_termination_passage_template_terminal as its . There shall be no more than one for a Component_termination_passage_template_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the terminal_connection_zone specifies the for the Component_termination_passage_template_terminal. There shall be one or more connection_zones for each terminal_connection_zone. The terminal_connection_zone is optional and need not be supplied if the data is unavailable in the source system. If the data is available in the source system, it shall be supplied.
the associated_definition specifies the role of the for the Component_termination_passage_template_terminal.
The combination of the associated_definition and the name inherited from shall be unique within a population of Component_termination_passage_template_terminals.

A Counterbore_passage_template is a type of . A Counterbore_passage_template is a combination of two round coaxial passages. The first passage is either a through-hole or a blind hole, and the orientation of the second passage (the counterbore) is the same as that of the first passage. The first passage is smaller than the second passage, which has a blind bottom condition that mates with the top of the first passage.
the larger_passage specifies the for the Counterbore_passage_template. The larger_passage specifies the data that is associated with the larger opening of the Counterbore.
the smaller_passage specifies the for the Counterbore_passage_template. The smaller_passage specifies the data that is associated with the smaller opening of the Counterbore.

A Countersunk_passage_template is a type of . A Countersunk_passage_template is a combination of two round coaxial passages, one cylindrical and one tapered. The initial diameter of the tapered passage will be larger than the diameter of the cylindrical passage, and will linearly taper to be the same diameter as the cylindrical passage where the two passages meet.
the tapered_passage specifies the for the Countersunk_passage_template. The tapered_passage specifies the data that is associated with the tapered area of the Countersunk passage.

the constant_diameter_passage specifies the for the Countersunk_passage_template. The constant_diameter_passage specifies the data that is associated with the constant diameter opening of the Countersunk passage.

An Inter_stratum_feature_template is a type of . An Inter_stratum_feature_template may be one of a , an , a , an , or an . An Inter_stratum_feature_template is a definitional construct that defines the cross-section shape of layered constructs.

the of_passage_technology specifies the role of the for the Inter_stratum_feature_template. The op_passage_technology specifies the material and layered properties for the Inter_stratum_feature_template.

ext_description.p: An Unsupported_passage_template is a type of .
ext_description.note: The Unsupported_passage_template associates shape information with the parametric property information. "Unsupported" carries the meaning that the passage is not mechanically or electrically supported by deposited sidewalls.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the of_passage_technology specifies the role of the for the Unsupported_passage_template.
A Blind_passage_template is a type of . The Blind_passage_template includes sufficient data to determine feature properties for passages that do not penetrate the complete substrate.
the bottom_distance_from_datum_reference specifies the role of the for the Blind_passage_template.
the datum_reference specifies the role of the for the Blind_passage_template.

the of_measure_orientation specifies normal or reversed as the measure orientation for the Blind_passage_template. Normal specifies that the orientation is parallel to the normal of the reference surface. Reversed specifies that the orientation is anti-parallel to the normal of the reference surface.

ext_description.p: A Via_template is a type of .
ext_description.note: A Via_template provides a template for a plated passage that supports the realization of connectivity. The access_mechanisms attribute relates the Via_template to two or more terminals, thereby capturing complete connectivity information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the access_mechanisms is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Via_template is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Via_template as its . There shall be two or more Via_template_terminals for a Via_template.
the of_passage_technology specifies the role of the for the Via_template.
A Component_termination_passage_template_join_terminal is a type of , an occurrence of which provides a fabrication join capability, within an optionally constrained set of .

the disallowed_inter_stratum_extent specifies the for which a connection to the Component_termination_passage_template_join_terminal is disallowed. The disallowed_inter_stratum_extent need not be supplied for a Component_termination_passage_template_join_terminal. There may be more than one for a Component_termination_passage_template_join_terminal.

A Via_template_terminal is a type of . A Via_template_terminal is a terminal in a . A Via_template_terminal is a terminal that is congruent with the exterior surface of the cylinder of the , including material covered by joined members of . The fabrication join capability is optionally constrained by a set of .

the terminal_connection_zone specifies the role of the for the Via_template_terminal. There may be one or more for the Via_template_terminal. The terminal_connection_zone is optional and need not be supplied if the data is unavailable in the source system. If the data is available in the source system, the data shall be provided.

the disallowed_inter_stratum_extent specifies the for which a connection to the Via_template_terminal is disallowed. The disallowed_inter_stratum_extent need not be supplied for a Via_template_terminal. There may be more than one for a Via_template_terminal.
the associated_definition specifies the role of the for the Via_template_terminal.
The combination of the name and associated_definition shall be unique within a population of Via_template_terminal.

ext_description.p: An Inter_stratum_join_relationship is a type of , in which the elements to be joined, , shall be on different . An Inter_stratum_join_relationship is a requirement for a .
ext_description.note: In order for a design to be complete the that specifies Inter_stratum_join_relationship in the role of topological_requirement must be populated.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the points_to_be_connected specifies the for the Inter_stratum_join_relationship. There shall be two or more layer_connection_points for each Inter_stratum_join_relationship.
An Intra_stratum_join_relationship is a type of in which all joins occur on one .

the random_implementation is an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Intra_stratum_join_relationship as its . There shall be no more than one for an Intra_stratum_join_relationship. The use of "random" in this context shall be interpreted as "having no intrinsic structure by design".

the ordered_implementation is an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Intra_stratum_join_relationship as its . There shall be no more than one for an Intra_stratum_join_relationship. The use of "ordered" in this context shall be interpreted as "having a distinct structure by design". It does not indicate a strictly linear sequence.
the points_to_be_connected specifies the for the Intra_stratum_join_relationship. There shall be two or more Layer_connection_points for each points_to_be_connected.
All Layer_connection_points specified shall be on the same .
At least one ordered_implementaton or random_implementation shall exist for a population of Intra_stratume_join_relationship.

A Join_relationship may be an , an , a , or an . A Join_relationship identifies a strict subset of the identified by topology. This subset is then inherited by both types of Join_relationship to ensure topological integrity.
the network_topology is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Join_relationship is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Join_relationship as its .
the associated_layout specifies the that is the design in which the Join_relationship is contained.

ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
ext_description.p: A Layer_connection_point is either a or an that resides on the surface of a in the and is defined in the coordinate system of the . The Layer_connection_point Application Object is an intersection concept between the topology requirements, placement requiremets defined in a geometric coordinate system and the material definition.
ext_description.note: A Layer_connection_point may be placed in an area where the conductive material is removed since there is no information contained in this Application Object regarding vertical material processes. It is the abstraction in this standard to separate lateral material description from the vertical material modification processes.

A Layer_connection_point should not be referenced by an extending on one side of the resident_design_layer_stratum and an embedded_component_path extending on the other side. Use the Same join relationship for the entire vertical extent.
Both two dimensional and three dimensional locations are provided to support the case where both a two dimensional and a three dimensional representation of the interconnect design exist.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the resident_design_layer_stratum specifies the upon which the Layer_connection_point is located.
the name identifies a Layer_connection_point.
There shall be at least one location for a Layer_connection_point.
If location_2d exists then the dimensionality of the geometric context shall be two.
If location_3d exists then the dimensionality of the geometric context shall be three.
Each member of Layer_connection_point shall be specified by no more than one member of .
The name, in combination with the resident_design_layer_stratum, shall be unique within a population of Layer_connection_point.
The location_2d, in combination with the resident_design_layer_stratum, shall be unique within a population of Layer_connection_point.
The location_3d, in combination with the resident_design_layer_stratum, shall be unique within a population of Layer_connection_point.

ext_description.p: A Stratum_embedded_component_join_relationship is a type of , in which the elements to be joined, , and , shall be on different materials in the interconnect, either or . A Stratum_embedded_component_join_relationship is a requirement for a or is a requirement for an . A Stratum_embedded_component_join_relationship is a between between materials that are fabricated as part of a manufacturing process and discrete material that is fabricated as part of a different process. A stratum embedded component join relationship associates one or more with one or more as part of the implementation of a . This is required since an is not directly referenced by a since an is not a . The are not required to be on the same .
ext_description.note: There may be more than one member of associated with this Application Object since some members of that are joined by a member of the Stratum_embedded_component_join_relationship may be on different .
The must reference this AO in order for the connection to the to be verified. The usual case is for one and one to be associated with one stratum embedded component join relationship.
There may be cases where a member of point_to_be_connected is associated with a referenced by a member of terminal_to_be_connected, and there may be more than one for a particular terminal.
The embedded classification of a component is made implicitly, by referencing that component in an assembly relationship with a design that is an interconnect.
In order for a design to be complete the implementations that specifies Stratum_embedded_component_join_relationship in the role of topological_requirement must be populated.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The same member of shall be the associated_component for all members of that are joined by a member of the Stratum_embedded_component_join_relationship.

A Default_attachment_size_and_component_termination_passage_based_land_physical_template is a type of and of . The shape of this template is dependent on both the requirements from the passage definition and the requirement for support of the interface between the instance of the intended to mate with an instance of the .
A Default_attachment_size_and_via_based_land_physical_template is a type of and of . This template shape is dependent on both the requirement from the and the shape of the related .
A Default_plated_passage_based_land_physical_template is a type of where the passage type is a . A Default_plated_passage_based_land_physical_template may be a .

ext_description.p: the of_passage_technology specifies the for the Default_plated_passage_based_land_physical_template.
ext_description.note: A is used because there is no difference in the used for a Via or a other than attributes values.

ext_description.p: A Default_passage_based_land_physical_template is a type of . A Default_passage_based_land_physical_template may be either a , a , or a . The shape of a based on this template is dependent on the shape of the passage with which it is associated.
ext_description.example: Figure illustrates the relationship between the minimum_annular_ring and the size category of finished hole for which the minimum_annular_ring is defined. The category information is specified in the member of associated with this Default_passage_based_land_physical_template.
ext_description.note: The usual domain technical reference is ANSI/IPC D-275.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the minimum_annular_ring specifies the of the smallest dimension between each point on the inner bound of a passage and the nearest point on the outer bound of a containing the passage for the Default_passage_based_land_physical_template.

the of_stratum_extent specifies the role of the for the Default_passage_based_land_physical_template. The of_stratum_extent specfies the actual subset of the passage specified by of_passage_technology to which this Default_passage_based_land_physical_template applies.
the of_passage_technology specifies the role of the for the Default_passage_based_land_physical_template.
the minimum_fabrication_allowance specifies the for the smallest dimension of the total of the manufacturing process tolerance effects for the Default_passage_based_land_physical_template.

The combination of the attribute of_passage_technology and the attribute of_stratum_technology inherited from the supertype shall be unique in a population of Default_passage_based_land_physical_template.
A Default_via_based_land_physical_template is a type of where the passage type is a . A Default_via_based_land_physical_template may be a .
the of_passage_technology specifies the role of the for the Default_via_based_land_physical_template.
A Default_unsupported_passage_based_land_physical_template is a type of where the passage type is a passage that has no metallized support.
the of_passage_technology specifies the for the Default_unsupported_passage_based_land_physical_template.

A Default_component_termination_passage_based_land_physical_template is a type of . A Default_component_termination_passage_based_land_physical_template may be a . The shape of the land template is dependent upon the requirements from .
the of_passage_technology that is inherited from the shall be redeclared as for the Default_component_termination_passage_based_land_physical_template.

A Laminate_layer is an extent of contiguous in a printed circuit board. The of all of a Laminate_layer are as alike in shape as process tolerances will allow; the design intent is that the shapes of the Stratum_features are to be identical. Standard usage is for exactly one of a or to be included in the referenced by extent.
the layer_usage specifies the that characterizes the purpose for incorporating the into a design. The layer_usage need not be specified for a particular .
the name specifies the for the . The name identifies the within the product.
the extent specifies the role of the for the .
The name shall be unique within a population of Layers for a product.

An Adjacent_stratum_surface_definition is a link in a sequence of stratum surfaces that result in the completed design. There may be multiple Adjacent_stratum_surface_definition that reference the same stratum surface in the case where are laterally adjacent. The use of Adjacent_stratum_surface_definition in combination with the position in 2D space of the within the interconnect is sufficient to uniquely identify the 3D location of the .
the subsequent_surface specifies the subsequent for the Adjacent_stratum_surface_definition.
the precedent_surface specifies the previous for the Adjacent_stratum_surface_definition.
the name specifies the string for the human-interpretable identifier for the Adjacent_stratum_surface_definition.
The precedent_surface shall be a secondary surface of a .
The subsequent_surface shall be a primary surface of a .
The name shall be unique with a population of Adjacent_stratum_surface_definition.
The combination of the precedent_surface and the subsequent_surface shall be unique within a population of Adjacent_stratum_surface_definition.
An Inter_stratum_extent is the extent of specified for a design purpose. The extent includes the from_stratum and to_stratum.

ext_description.p: the to_stratum specifies the at one end of the Inter_stratum_extent. This is further from the whose primary_design_layer_stratum attribute value is TRUE than is the from_stratum.
ext_description.note: The to_stratum by convention is furthest from the primary side of the assembly, and closest to the secondary side of the assembly.

ext_description.p: the from_stratum specifies the at one end of the Inter_stratum_extent. This is the closer to the whose primary_design_layer_stratum attribute value is TRUE than is the to_stratum.
ext_description.note: The from_stratum by convention is closest to the primary side of the assembly and furthest from the secondary side of the assembly.

ext_description.p: A Laminate_group_laminate_group_component_make_from_relationship is a type of . A Laminate_group_laminate_group_component_make_from_relationship is the association between one and another , where one from full or partial reuse of the other. A Laminate_group_laminate_group_component_make_from_relationship also supports mapping of a in the reference design to a in this design.
ext_description.note: The main use of this concept is use of multi-layer breakout definitions for complex integrated circuits where there is a mapping from a in the reference_footprint.reference_layout to a stratum in this layout.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the stratum_mapping specifies the for the Laminate_group_component_make_from_relationship. There shall be one or more for each stratum_mapping.
the resultant_component specifies the that results from the reuse in the Laminate_group_component_make_from_relationship.
the reusable_component specifies the that is reused to create the resultant_component in the Laminate_group_component_make_from_relationship.

ext_description.p: A Stratum may be a or a . A Stratum consists of a single material within an interconnect substrate. The vertical contours of either boundary surface may vary. Thus, the thickness of the stratum may vary throughout its range. The material used may be specific, such as 24K gold, or more general, such as etched copper. There may only be one boundary.
ext_description.example: Figure illustrates a detail of a stackup drawing included on a fabrication drawing in some cases. In most cases, the detail in this figure is generated at the fabricator's facility from more generic engineering data. This part of ISO 10303 is capable of supporting exchange of generic material stackup data or very explicit material stackup data. This part of ISO 10303 considers either stackup data set as design data. An enterprise may track the source of the stackup data through the design_supplier attribute of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the stratum_usage specifies the that describes the purpose for incorporating a stratum in the design. The stratum_usage need not be specified for a particular Stratum.
the assembly is an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Stratum as its . There shall be one or more for a Stratum, but they shall all be for the same product.
an of_surface is an inverse attribute which specifies one or two for a Stratum.
an of_average_surface is an inverse attribute which specifies the of the Stratum as its of_stratum. There shall be no more than one for a Stratum.
the name specifies an identifier of a Stratum and is equal to the product_definition_id attribute inherited from .
the of_technology specifies the role of the for the Stratum.
An Interconnect_module_stratum_assembly_relationship is the composition association between an and the helping to compose it.

the reference_designation specifies the for the Interconnect_module_stratum_assembly_relationship. The reference_designation specifies the string for the human-interpretable identifier for the Interconnect_module_stratum_assembly_relationship.
the component specifies the role of the for the Interconnect_module_stratum_assembly_relationship.
the assembly specifies the role of the for the Interconnect_module_stratum_assembly_relationship.
The combination of the assembly and the reference_designation shall be unique within a population of Interconnect_module_stratum_assembly_relationship.

ext_description.p: A Design_layer_stratum is a type of incorporated into an for the purpose of realizing a physical network in one material.
ext_description.note: Design_layer_stratum are usually described as a signal layer or a power or ground plane.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the library_definition is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Design_layer_stratum is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Design_layer_stratum as its . There shall be zero or one for a Design_layer_stratum.

the existence_dependence is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Design_layer_stratum is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Design_layer_stratum as its . There shall be one or more for a Design_layer_stratum.
the of_technology specifies the role of the for the Design_layer_stratum.

ext_description.p: the primary_design_layer_stratum specifies whether or not the Design_layer_stratum is the primary_stratum of the product. The value of TRUE indicates that the Design_layer_stratum is the primary_design_layer_stratum, meaning that it is the stratum occupying the side of the product that has been arbitrarily chosen to be the primary side. The value of FALSE indicates that the Design_layer_stratum is not the primary_design_layer_stratum.
ext_description.note: Usual industry practice is to specify the primary stratum as that which has more components or more active components on it, but this part of ISO 10303 does not enforce that practice.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The value of TRUE for the primary_design_layer_stratum shall be specified if and only if the Design_layer_stratum is assigned to the . The Design_layer_stratum shall be assigned to the if and only if the primary_design_layer_stratum is TRUE.

ext_description.p: A Documentation_layer_stratum is a type of used to describe patterns and other artwork information needed to manufacture a from materials which are not independently implementing a in the printed circuit board.
ext_description.example: A Documentation_layer_stratum generally refers to those layers in domain terms for which there is a specifically designed shape other than, or in addition to, that of the printed circuit board edge, and for which the CAD systems traditionally output a separate master artwork pattern or file, but for which the resulting pattern is not for an independent conductive layer. For a "six layer pcb", in domain terms, there are six independently conductive design layers. This part of ISO 10303 allows the "outer layers" to be described by several to accommodate the different metallurgies that are found on electroless copper plated, electrolytic copper plated, and solder plated or solder coated on the primary and secondary sides of the . The usual design view of the shape of these "outer layers" is that the shapes are identical for all practical purposes and the required shape is the cumulative shape that will appear after all the manufacturing processes are completed. A of conductive material, such as solder paste, is not an independently conductive layer in this context, since its shape is usually dependent upon the independently conductive layer over which it is applied through openings in solder mask or another Documentation_layer_stratum.
ext_description.note: The general case of dielectric layers such as the adhesive , or the consisting of the dielectric substrate between two copper foil in a printed circuit board, is that they are neither a Documentation_layer_stratum nor a . Their shapes are totally dependent upon the overall shape of the printed circuit board and its various passages.
ext_description.example: If the stratum purpose is that of a coverlay, the insulating sheet on the outer surface of a flexible printed harness and the die-cut passages in the dielectric material of the coverlay are defined as Inter_stratum_features. A is used to describe the presence of the material. This in this context is neither a nor a Documentation_layer_stratum.

A Documentation_layer_stratum differs from a in that its Ee_materials include such materials as solder maskant, epoxy ink, or dielectric materials; or materials such as solder paste that are described as conductive by the of the but whose shape is dependent upon that of an independently described .

An example of the shape of an independently described of conductive materials is that of the copper to be found in the traces and lands on the printed circuit board. The shape of a of solder paste is often dependent upon the shape of the of solder mask that in turn is dependent upon the shape of the circuitry on the primary and secondary sides of the over which the solder mask and solder paste are applied.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the library_definition is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Documentation_layer_stratum is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Documentation_layer_stratum as its . There shall be zero or one for a Documentation_layer_stratum.
the of_technology specifies the role of the for the Documentation_layer_stratum.

ext_description.p: A Passage_technology may be either a , a , or a . A Passage_technology specifies material properties and parametric data associated with a specific manufacturing process for identified material, where that material and manufacturing process has been selected for a specific design. A Passage_technology includes the material stackup parametric data related to the design of the interconnect substrate associated with the the Passage_technology is related to through the as_finished_inter_stratum_extent attribute. None of the referenced by as_finished_inter_stratum_extent is required to be the same material as the deposition_material.
ext_description.note: There is no requirement that Passage_technology application increase the extent of the stackup that existed prior to application of the Passage_technology.

ext_description.p: the as_finished_inter_stratum_extent specifies the that will be created for the Passage_technology. Material additions by plating or other means will extend the reach of the to the as-finished condition because these are not present during the machining operation but are created during the finishing operations.
ext_description.note: There is no requirement that the deposition process extend the reach of the on both ends of the passage. There is no requirement that the deposition process extend the reach of the at all.
ext_description.example: A blind via may be deposited from the top, resulting in only two in the as_finished_inter_stratum_extent, only one of which is conductive.

A via may be deposited from the top, with subsequent finishing operation removing all material except the wall resulting in only one in the as_finished_inter_stratum_extent, none of which is conductive.

ext_description.p: the associated_definition specifies the role of the that uses the Passage_technology.
ext_description.note: The Passage_technology is for a particular design since the vertical extent is within the context of the design.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Default_component_termination_passage_definition is a type of that defines a default passage based on characteristics of the associated .
the minimum_as_finished_passage_extent specifies one role of the for the Default_component_termination_passage_definition.
the minimum_as_finished_deposition_thickness specifies one role of the for the Default_component_termination_passage_definition.
the deposition_material specifies the role of the for the Default_component_termination_passage_definition.
the maximum_allowed_component_terminal_extent specifies one role of the for the Default_component_termination_passage_definition.
the minimum_allowed_component_terminal_extent specifies one role of the for the Default_component_termination_passage_definition.
A Default_unsupported_passage_definition is a type of where the passage is unsupported by metallization.
the minimum_as_finished_passage_extent specifies one role of the for the .

ext_description.p: A Default_via_definition is a type of that defines the default shape of the . Mandatory properties are identified.
ext_description.note: The as_finished_inter_stratum_extent need not start or terminate on material that is the deposition_material, nor must any in the extent be conductive. For additional notes, reference .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the minimum_as_finished_passage_extent specifies one role of the for the Default_via_definition.
the minimum_as_finished_deposition_thickness specifies the that is the lower bound for the thickness of the deposited for the Default_via_definition.
the deposition_material specifies the role of the in the for the Default_via_definition.
The passage deposition material shall be conductive.

ext_description.p: An Embedded_component_terminal is a type of included in the design to mate directly with a terminal of a fabricated feature by use of a internally in a layout. An Embedded_component_terminal is a model specifically included to bridge between the discrete purchased items used in a design and the custom fabricated interconnect patterns in a substrate design. An Embedded_component_terminal is an instance of a usage definition for access to a discrete component in the context of a substrate design. An Embedded_component_terminal is included to support using to define the implementation connections to the associated component.
ext_description.note: The modeling approach used here does not imply that Embedded_component_terminal is created as part of the wet or dry chemistr process used to create the patterns on the substrate. It is merely identifying a functional role of a terminal of a discrete part when it is embedded in a substrate. By implication, it is also identifying the role of the associated component, i.e. that the associated component is embedded in the substrate. The method or process of achieving this is not defined in this standard. The Embedded_component_terminal will not be included in a and is treated herein similarly to the terminals. A is required to connect the terminal to the adjacent to satisfy functional connectivity requirements.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the associated_component specifies the role of the or the role of the for the Embedded_component_terminal.
the definition specifies the role of the or the role of the for the Embedded_component_terminal.

ext_description.p: A Primary_stratum_indicator_symbol is a type of that is used to identify the arbitrarily named primary side of a printed circuit board.
ext_description.note: This symbol may be found in the stratum material of the conductive stratum that is on the primary side of the printed circuit board, implemented in a stratum of silk-screen printed marking ink on the primary side, or otherwise. The primary side is normally defined as that side of the printed circuit board which will contain the largest number of components, but in cases where the component count is balanced, the primary side is arbitrarily named for convenience. Not all printed circuit boards contain this symbol.

ext_description.p: A Special_symbol_laminate_component is a type of such as an enterprise logo, trademark, or other enterprise specific symbol. A Special_symbol_laminate_component may be a .
ext_description.note: A Special_symbol_laminate_component may or may not be limited to a member of a library of accepted symbols.
A Special_symbol_laminate_component may or may not be scalable. A Special_symbol_laminate_component may or may not be associated with a physical net.
These symbols may be stored in a library for legal reasons.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the stratum_feature_implementation specifies the role of the for the Special_symbol_laminate_component.
the derived_from specifies the role of the for the Special_symbol_laminate_component.

ext_description.p: An Interconnect_module is a type of . An Interconnect_module may be a or a . An Interconnect_module is a design view of a product. An Interconnect_module may be an aggregation of . An Interconnect_module may be an aggregation of An Interconnect_module features are defined by , within the bounds established by .
ext_description.note: Not all products defined by this design view are classified in general as interconnect substrates.
ext_description.example: A package may be defined by the design owners using the Interconnect_module design view.
A ribbon cable, minus the connectors, may be defined by the design owners using the Interconnect_module design view. Complex 3d arrangements of the ribbon may be supported.

Figure illustrates two categories of complex land patterns. For a specific technology implementation in an Interconnect_module, all parameters would be assigned specific values, in addition to the explicit geometry and material descriptions otherwise provided.

figure.title: Complex technology specific land pattern definition

ext_description.example: Figure illustrates two categories of simple land patterns. For a specific technology implementation in an Interconnect_module, all parameters would be assigned specific values, in addition to the explicit geometry and material descriptions otherwise provided.

figure.title: Simple technology specific land pattern definition

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the of_fabrication_thickness_requirement is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Interconnect_module is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Interconnect_module as its . There shall be zero more more for an Interconnect_module.
Interconnect_module.usage_view (this is an inherited attribute from ) shall be either an or a .
There shall be exactly one primary design layer stratum in the Interconnect_module.

ext_description.p: A Component_termination_passage is a type of through which a may pass. The properties of the Component_termination_passage are selected to support the .
ext_description.note: The model in this part of ISO 10303 is that the wall of the passage is directly supporting current flow.
Support for the member of that passes through an but is not assembled to the wall of that is provided by the concept.
Support for the member of that electrically is connected only to the surface of an is provided by the concept.
There is no requirement for the Component_termination_passage to completely penetrate the interconnect substrate.
ext_description.example: Figure 1 is a detail of a layout drawing that superimposes components from the next level of assembly in order to illustrate the physical relationship of a Component_termination_passage to the terminals of those components. This example omits the details of how this part of ISO 10303 establishes the relationship between the terminal and the passage for clarity.
Figure 2 is a detail of a cross-section of an interconnect substrate showing a case of complete penetration of the substrate by the Component_termination_passage.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the interface_access_mechanism is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Component_termination_passage is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Component_termination_passage as its .

the access_mechanism is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Component_termination_passage is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Component_termination_passage as its . There shall be one or more for a Component_termination_passage.
the derived_from inherited from shall be redeclared as for the Component_termination_passage.

ext_description.p: A Component_termination_passage_interface_terminal is a type of . The Component_termination_passage_interface_terminal is the internal wall of the passage only and is the complete internal wall. It does not extend to the exterior top or bottom edges of the passage. It does not include an exterior surface of the passage. This terminal is the definition of an interface mechanism for an interconnect.
ext_description.note: In normal usage, the interior wall has a smaller diameter than the exterior wall.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the associated_component that is inherited from the shall be redeclared as for the Component_termination_passage_interface_terminal.
the definition that is inherited from the shall be redeclared as for the Component_termination_passage_interface_terminal.

ext_description.p: A Component_termination_passage_join_terminal is a type of . The Component_termination_passage_join_terminal is the exterior surface of the passage. The exterior surface has a larger nominal diameter than the interior surface.
ext_description.note: One Component_termination_passage_join_terminal may be related to multiple Land_join_terminals, since each stratum may have a associated with the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the associated_component specifies the role of the for the Component_termination_passage_join_terminal.
the definition specifies the role of the for the Component_termination_passage_join_terminal.

ext_description.p: A Conductive_interconnect_element is a type of . A Conductive_interconnect_element is either a or an . A Conductive_interconnect_element specifies one portion of a that has a sequential arrangement of .
ext_description.note: A domain term for a Conductive_interconnect_element is a trace. The domain term may include additional aspects over that defined in this application object in certain cases. For that reason, this part of ISO 10303 does not attempt to prescribe or limit the application of the term trace by standardizing it.
ext_description.example: An example of multiple Conductive_interconnect_element, , and that contribute to the definition of a are shown in the partially exploded view of a in figure .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the access_mechanisms is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Conductive_interconnect_element is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Conductive_interconnect_element as its . There shall be at least two Conductive_interconnect_element_terminals for a Conductive_interconnect_element.
the composed_conductor specifies the for the Conductive_interconnect_element. The composed_conductor need not be specified for a Conductive_interconnect_element.

ext_description.p: A Conductive_interconnect_element_terminal is a type of . The Conductive_interconnect_element_terminal is a terminal for the trace defined by .
ext_description.note: This is used for detailed design and analysis, and also as a means to check the quality of geometry representation and transfer.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the location specifies the role of the for the Conductive_interconnect_element_terminal.
the name specifies the string for the human-interpretable identifier for the Conductive_interconnect_element_terminal.

the connection specifies the role of the for the Conductive_interconnect_element_terminal. The connection is optional and need not supplied if the data is not available in the source system. If the data is available in the source system, it shall be supplied.
the associated_component specifies the role of the for the Conductive_interconnect_element_terminal.
The same shall be referenced by the path starting at location and the path starting at associated_component inherited from the .
The combination of name and associated_component inherited from shall be unique within a population of Conductive_interconnect_element_terminal.
A Conductive_interconnect_element_terminal_link is a directed link between two in order to support the sequence of required in .
a subsequent_point specifies one role of the for a Conductive_interconnect_element_terminal_link.
a precedent_point specifies one role of the for a Conductive_interconnect_element_terminal_link.
an associated_element specifies the role of the for a Conductive_interconnect_element_terminal_link.
The precedent_point shall not be the subsequent_point.
The precedent_point shall be on the associated_element.
The subsequent_point shall be on the associated_element.
The combination of precedent_point and subsequent_point shall be unique within a population of Conductive_interconnect_element_terminal_link.

ext_description.p: A Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions is a type of . A Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions may be a . The data provided by Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions is typical data available from two dimensional CAD applications. The data does not include explicit representation of the variability in the vertical dimension that occurs in a real "planar" product due to material build up of successive layers of material. The usage_definition is required to be orthogonal to the centreline_shape_representation, but this is insufficient information in a three-dimensional layout. In a two-dimensional layout, the usage_definition shape x direction vector is constrained to be parallel with the x direction vector of the shape of the referenced by the inherited attribute composed_conductor. In a two-dimensional design, all Stratum_features are parallel. In a three-dimensional design, the same parallelism constraint applies, but the underlying substrate is not presumed to be planar. The underlying surface shape idealization is contained in the or . The or shall be populated to specify to a processor the design intent. The centreline_shape_representation shall be a subset of either the points in the or of the points in the .
ext_description.note: The "pre-defined transition" refers to the extrusion of the shape (a cross-sectional definition) along the path defined by its centreline_shape_representation (a ).

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the connected_points is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions as its . There shall be one or more for a Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions.
the composed_conductor specifies the role of the for the Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions.

ext_description.p: the centreline_shape specifies the representing the centreline of the Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions. The centreline when combined with the usage_definition provides a CAD abstraction of the physical shape. The centreline_shape shall be interpreted to be a curve defined within the geometric context of the shape of the design.
ext_description.note: There is no or associated with the Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions because the shape is defined in place in the design. There is no or associated with the associated with the Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions for the same reason.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the derived_from specifies the role of the for the Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions. The derived_from is a cross section definition. When combined with the centreline shape, a complete CAD abstraction is formed for the two-dimensional case. The three-dimensional case requires additional data representing the abstract surface in which the conductor being defined will be located.
A Connected_area_component is a type of .
the associated_layer_connection_point specifies the for the Connected_area_component. There shall be one or more for each associated_layer_connection_point.

An Electrical_isolation_laminate_component is a type of that indicates that material is to be removed in the realization of the feature that is in the role of design_intent inherited from . The requirement shall be interpreted mathematically as a requirement for application of the regularized Boolean subtraction operation.
the derived_from specifies the role of the for the Electrical_isolation_laminate_component.

A Fiducial is a type of that is a basis of measurement with respect to other Assembly_components. A Fiducial is used for accurate alignment of one item with another. Another type of may play the role of Fiducial in a design.

ext_description.p: A Filled_area_material_removal_laminate_component is a type of that indicates that material is to be removed in the realization of the feature that is in the role of design_intent inherited from . A Filled_area_material_removal_laminate_component is either an or a . The requirement shall be interpreted mathematically as a requirement for application of the regularized Boolean subtraction operation. The design_intent inherited from shall not be a .
ext_description.note: In some cases, the isolation may be accomplished by complete removal, as in a dielectric removal from a dielectric layer or layers.

ext_description.p: A Footprint_occurrence is a type of . A Footprint_occurrence references a as a usage_definition. A Footprint_occurrence is not a , nor is it a , nor is it a . A Footprint_occurrence is specifically provided to eliminate redundant location information for Lands on different layers and at different x,y locations and other layered concepts that are typically grouped to support the placement of a component.
ext_description.note: This Application Object is provided for high density array footprint occurrences.

This Application Object should not be used to relate Padstack_occurrences. The structure is provided in to relate a to a in a geometric context. Further relationships in the design view will be redundant.
A should be used to related a to this Application Object since that relationship contains sufficient information to query the for the definition detailed information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the component is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Footprint_occurrence is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Footprint_occurrence as its . There shall be one or more for a Footprint_occurrence.
the derived_from specifies the role of the for the Footprint_occurrence.

ext_description.p: A Footprint_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship is an association that specifies a subassembly constraint among two or more that is aggregated into an . A Footprint_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship does not directly reference the Application Object that is the for the . Instead, it uses an indexing mechanism provided by terminal_location and sub_assembly_refence_designation to locate the padstack in the and the land template location in that . The Footprint_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship relies on the fact that there is no more than one for the and that that shape is referenced by the path through the .
ext_description.example: A may participate in a . In that case, there is no need to populate a separate between the and the Pcb, since the between the and the Pcb establishes the required association.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the terminal_location specifies the for the Footprint_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship.
the sub_assembly_reference_designation specifies the for the Footprint_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship.
the relating_view specifies the independent which is the aggregation of two or more specified by related_component for the Footprint_occurence_sub_assembly_relationship.
the related_view specifies the for the Footprint_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship.
The referenced by terminal_location.footprint shall be the same that is referenced by the usage_definition attribute of the relating_component.
The referenced by sub_assembly_reference_designation.padstack shall be the same that is referenced by the padstack attribute of the terminal_location.

The referenced by usage_definition of the inherited from shall be referenced by the associated_template_occurrence attribute of the that is referenced by the template attribute of the that is referenced by sub_assembly_reference_designation.
The combination of relating_component, terminal_location, and sub_assembly_reference_designation shall be unique in a population of Footprint_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship.

ext_description.p: An Inter_stratum_feature is a type of . An Inter_stratum_feature is one of a , a , a , an , an , a , or an . An Inter_stratum_feature spans one or more .
ext_description.note: An Inter_stratum_feature may be realized by removal of material by drilling, routing, punching, chemically etching, laser burning, or otherwise penetrating one or more sequential ; by the addition of material; or by combining both removal and addition of material in the fabrication process.
Keep out or keep in regions can be specified by populating and its optional set of Interconnect_module_desgin_object_select. The can select an Inter_startum_feature as the design feature of interest.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the derived_from specifies the role of the for the Inter_stratum_feature.

the feature_of_size specifies whether or not the Inter_stratum_feature interfaces with a feature of another product in an assembly context. A value of TRUE specifies that it interfaces. A value of FALSE specifies that it does not interface.

ext_description.p: An Interface_access_material_removal_laminate_component is a type of that indicates that material is to be removed in the realization of access to the .
ext_description.example: If a passage in a silkscreen layer is necessary to gain access to a and it is desire to record the reason for the passage, this Application Object provides that capability.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the accessed_interface specifies the role of the for the Interface_access_material_removal_laminate_component.

ext_description.p: An Interface_access_stratum_feature_template_component is a type of provided to provide access to a where auxiliary processes would prohibit direct access to the terminal and where it is necessary to record the explicit relationship.
ext_description.note: A solderpaste may cover the terminal and in some cases it is necessary to denote the fact that the terminal is below the solderpaste. If it is not necessary to explicitly identify the fact that the solderpaste covers the terminal, this Application Object would not be populated. Those cases would occur where geometry queries are sufficient. The Interface_access_stratum_feature_template_component is not on the same as the terminal being accessed.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the accessed_interface specifies the role of the for the Interface_access_stratum_feature_template_component.

ext_description.p: A Join_two_physical_connectivity_definition_supporting_printed_component is a type of . The Join_two_physical_connectivity_definition_supporting_printed_component is included specifically for cases in which analog and digital grounds are kept topologically and physically separate completely through the design process to minimize noise but need to be physically connected for reference voltage purposes.
ext_description.note: This connections is usually required to be at one and only one location.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the joined_definitions specifies the for the Join_two_physical_connectivity_definition_supporting_printed_component. There shall be exactly two physical_connectivity_definitions for a Join_two_physical_connectivity_definition_supporting_printed_component.

ext_description.p: A Laminate_component is a type of . A Laminate_component may be one of a , an , a , a , a , a , a or a , or additionally may be a , or additionally may be a . All types of Laminate_component are realized as part of the manufacturing process that produces the interconnect. The scope of the Laminate_component is the interconnect definition. Not all components that are realized by the manufacturing process that produces the interconnect are Laminate_component.
ext_description.example: A Laminate_component is not a even though both may be realized by the same manufacturing process that produces the interconnect.
ext_description.note: A Laminate_component does not appear in an assembly definition.
A Laminate_component is only one of several Application Objects that may be referenced by a or by subtypes of .

A Laminate_component is not an embedded component because an embedded component is a discrete component with separately described physical properties that is processed by the manufacturing process that produces the interconnect.

An embedded component is not an explicit Application Object but is a implicit role of a discrete component established by the inclusion in an interconnect design view of a discrete component by a member of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the cad_layer specifies the role of the for the Laminate_component. The cad_layer need not be specified for a Laminate_component.

the footprint_occurrence_assembly is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Laminate_component is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Laminate_component as its . There shall be zero or one for each Laminate_component.

the padstack_occurrence_assembly is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Laminate_component is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Laminate_component as its . There shall be zero or one for each Laminate_component.
the derived_from specifies the role of the for the Laminate_component. The value of this attribute is optional and need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
A Laminate_component_feature is a type of whose scope is that of an interconnect definition. A Laminate_component_feature may be a , or a , or a , or a .
A Laminate_component_feature is a feature of the fabricated interconnect that is either internal or external. A Laminate_component_feature may reference either an item fabricated directly in the interconnect fabrication or a discrete component that is included in the interconnect fabrication process. The scope is the determinant in whether a feature is a Laminate_component_feature or a .
ext_description.note: The scope of a is a discrete assembly.
ext_description.example: A Laminate_component_feature may reference an embedded component as an associated component to indicate that the internal interconnect structure implements a connection to the embedded component. The reference to the embedded component does not imply that that embedded component is fabricated as part of the interconnect.

A Laminate_component_feature may reference a printed component as an associated component to indicate that the internal interconnect structure implements a connection to the printed component. The connection to the printed component is considered separately because the functionality of the printed component is considered separately.
A Laminate_component_feature may reference a as an associated component to indicate that the internal interconnect structure implements a connection to the .

ext_description.p: A Laminate_component_interface_terminal is a type of . A Laminate_component_interface_terminal may be a , a , a , or a . A Laminate_component_interface_terminal is a terminal that is externally visible but that is fabricated as part of the interconnect fabrication. A Laminate_component_interface_terminal may reference either an item that is a or that is a .
ext_description.example: A Laminate_component_interface_terminal may reference a printed connector component as an associated component to indicate that the internal interconnect structure implements a connection to the printed connector component. The connection to the printed connector component is considered separately because the functionality of the printed connector component is considered separately.
A Laminate_component_interface_terminal may reference a as an associated component to indicate that the internal interconnect structure implements a connection to the .

ext_description.p:
A Laminate_component_join_terminal is a type of and a type of . A Laminate_component_join_terminal may be a , a , a , an , or a .
A Laminate_component_join_terminal is a terminal that is internal to the fabricated interconnect. A Laminate_component_join_terminal may reference either an item fabricated directly in the interconnect fabrication or a discrete item that is included in the interconnect fabrication process as a dissimilar material.
ext_description.example: A Laminate_component_join_terminal may reference an embedded component as an associated component to indicate that the internal interconnect structure implements a connection to the embedded component.

A Laminate_component_join_terminal may reference a printed component as an associated component to indicate that the internal interconnect structure implements a connection to the printed component. The connection to the printed component is considered separately because the functionality of the printed component is considered separately.
A Laminate_component_join_terminal may reference a as an associated component to indicate that the internal interconnect structure implements a connection to the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the node_implementation is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Laminate_component_join_terminal is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Laminate_component_join_terminal as its . There shall be zero or one for a Laminate_component_join_terminal.

ext_description.p: A Laminate_text_component is a type of that is designed to be interpreted as a single character portion of a text message by a human or by an artificial vision system. A Laminate_text_component may be used to help compose a to form a complete message. The composition will be defined by an instance of that relates all necessary members of to compose the message embodied in the instance of . Each referenced by the stratum_feature_implementation shall be on the same .
ext_description.example: Figure illustrates possible arrangements and orientation of the in the material of the . The figure includes multiple Laminate_text_component members presenting characters.

ext_description.p: the stratum_feature_implementation specifies the role of the for the Laminate_text_component. There shall be one or more for a Laminate_text_component.
ext_description.note: Multiple may exist in the case that the shape of the character is disjoint, but they are all on the same .
