ext_descriptions.ext_description: the derived_from specifies the role of the that contains the font definition and associated parameters to be used for the Laminate_text_component. The value of this attribute is optional and need not be specified.
the of_character specifies the message content, a character, for the Laminate_text_component.

ext_description.p: A Laminate_text_string_component is a type of and is a type of . A Laminate_text_string_component conveys a complete one line message to the viewer. A Laminate_text_string_component is composed by associating one or more individual instances of to the Laminate_text_string_component using one instance of . The Laminate_text_string_component itself does not directly refer to a font definition. The usage_definition inherited from the supertype is unnecessary since this Application Object is defined by the composition of contributing to it. The position of the Laminate_text_string_component shall be interpreted as a constraint on the position of the individual components contributing to it. The position of the Laminate_text_string_component shall be interpreted as the insertion point for the message. The Laminate_text_string_component may have an orientation with respect to the design coordinate system, in which case the components composing the Laminate_text_string_component shall have a corresponding orientation. The or which locates the Laminate_text_string_component shall be interpreted as a local coordinate system in order that any orientation shall be applied consistently to all components. An implementation shall ensure that adjacent characters that use different fonts still meet the requirement that instances are disjoint.
ext_description.note: If multi-line messages are required, multiple instances of Laminate_text_string_component will be needed, one for each line of the message.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the of_vertical_justification specifies the for the Laminate_text_string_component. The specifies either "top", "bottom", or "centre" for the beginning point of the message with respect to the position of the or that is the insertion point for the text. The "top" indicates that the top edge of the bounding box of the first character of the message is aligned with the 'X' axis of the . The "bottom" indicates that the bottom edge of the bounding box of the last character of the message is aligned with the 'X' axis of the . The "centre" indicates that the top edge of the bounding box of the first character of the message and the bottom edge of the bounding box of the last character of the message are equally displaced on either side of the 'X' axis of the .

the of_horizontal_justification specifies the for the Laminate_text_string_component. The specifies either "left", "right", or "centre" for the beginning point of the message with respect to the position of the or that is the insertion point for the text. The "left" indicates that the left edge of the bounding box of the first character of the message is aligned with the 'Y' axis of the . The "right" indicates that the right edge of the bounding box of the last character of the message is aligned with the 'Y' axis of the . The "centre" indicates that the left edge of the bounding box of the first character of the message and the right edge of the bounding box of the last character of the message are equally displaced on either side of the 'Y' axis of the .
the message_contents specifies the for the Laminate_text_string_component. The message_contents specifies the message_contents content, a string, for the Laminate_text_string_component.

A Material_removal_laminate_component is a type of that indicates that material is to be removed in the realization of the feature that is in the role of design_intent. A Material_removal_laminate_component may be a . The requirement shall be interpreted mathematically as a requirement for application of the regularized Boolean subtraction operation. A Material_removal_laminate_component may participate in a relationship with a in the case of complex layout arrangements to resolve the order of the Boolean operations.
the design_intent specifies the for the Material_removal_laminate_component. The design_intent specifies the role of the or of the for the Material_removal_laminate_component.
the derived_from specifies the role of the for the Material_removal_laminate_component.

ext_description.p: A Multi_layer_material_removal_laminate_component is a type of that indicates that material is to be removed in multiple layers based on the same explicit geometry. The geometric transformations between the are used to position the geometry on the dependent .
ext_description.note: This Application Object is not intended to be used in place of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the derived_layer_geometry specifies the role of the for the Multi_layer_material_removal_laminate_component. Each referenced by receives the same material shape to within process tolerances.

ext_description.p: A Multi_layer_stratum_feature is a type of . A Multi_layer_stratum_feature causes shapes to be realized in the material of multiple sequential which are all bases on the geometry for the feature. Each shape is effectively a in that , but due to the identical nature of the geometry, there is no need to separately model the geometry. Each shape in the sequential is isolated from other shapes in that .
ext_description.example: Gold plating on Conductors that is based directly on the underlying Copper shape is an example of this Application Object.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the derived_layer_geometry specifies the role of the for the Multi_layer_stratum_feature.

ext_description.p: A Multi_layer_stratum_feature_template_component is a type of . A Multi_layer_stratum_feature_template_component is included to allow the creation of shapes on sequential where those shapes are identical to the shape that references the Multi_layer_stratum_feature_template_component.
ext_description.example: The domain feature known as "edge finger connector" consists of multiple of Copper, Nickel, Gold and each material shape is based on the shape of the underlying in the Copper .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the derived_layer_geometry specifies the role of the for the Multi_layer_stratum_feature_template_component.

A Padstack_occurrence is a type of . A Padstack_occurrence organizes the various and Inter_stratum_features so that one placement may suffice for all Application Objects that are derived from the placement of one padstack.

the component is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Padstack_occurrence is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Padstack_occurrence as its . There shall be one or more for a Padstack_occurrence.
the derived_from inherited from the specifies the role of the for the Padstack_occurrence.

A Padstack_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship is an association that specifies a subassembly constraint among two or more that is aggregated into an . A may participate in a . In that case, there is no need to populate a separate between the and the Pcb, since the between the and the Pcb establishes the required association. Also, in that case, there is no need to separately populate the usage_definition from to because the template may be deduced from the structure. A Via may appear in a .

ext_description.p: the sub_assembly_reference_designation specifies the which is the identifier for this Padstack_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship in the context of the relating_component.
ext_description.note: The uniqueness rule that includes sub_assembly_reference_designation in this Application Object is only needed to constrain the population of Padstack_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship so that the combination of attributes is unique for query purposes. A synthetic string may be created by a receiving application for human interaction purposes but there is no exchange requirement on that string.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the relating_view specifies the independent which is the aggregation of two or more specified by related_component for the Padstack_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship.
the related_view specifies the dependent of the Padstack_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship.

ext_description.p: The combination of relating_component, related_component, and sub_assembly_reference_designation shall be unique in a population of Padstack_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship.
ext_description.example: An application of multiple Padstack_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship referencing the same related_component is for the case of split power planes where a pad sits between two power planes and there are three signals, one for each of the power planes and one for the pad.

ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
ext_description.p: A Pcb is a type of . A Pcb describes a printed circuit board. A printed circuit board is nearly a synonym for printed wiring board, except that a printed circuit board may include printed components and a printed wiring board is totally interconnected without printed components. This part of ISO 10303 supports the exchange of product categories in order to allow the exchange partners to differentiate between printed wiring board and printed circuit board.
ext_description.example: Figure illustrates a printed wiring board design.

Figures and illustrate complex printed wiring board mechanical designs that have functional shape requirements that are communicated using Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing information in a product model and not graphically.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the usage_view specifies the role of the for the Pcb. The usage_view shall not be specified if the Pcb is a , otherwise it shall exist.

ext_description.p: A Plated_inter_stratum_feature is a type of with deposited metal on its walls that makes an electrical connection between conductive patterns on internal , external , or both, of a printed circuit board. A Plated_inter_stratum_feature is one of a , a , a , a , or a , or additionally may be a .
ext_description.note: A cross-section illustration of Plated_inter_stratum_feature that is the result of a wet chemistry process is shown in figure . An expanded view of one section of the feature is shown in figure .
Plated_inter_stratum_features that completely pass through the PCB are sometimes known as plated through holes.
Plated_inter_stratum_features are features that may be custom designed for this design by creating custom shapes.

ext_description.p: A Plated_passage is a type of . A Plated_passage may be either a or a .
ext_description.example: Figure graphically collects the various types of plated passages into a more generic category.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the stratum_feature_implementation specifies the that the Stratum_feature_template_component is helping to compose.
the derived_from specifies the role of the for the Stratum_feature_template_component.

A Thermal_isolation_laminate_component is a type of that indicates that material is to be removed in the realization of the feature that is in the role of design_intent inherited from . A Thermal_isolation_laminate_component may be a . The requirement shall be interpreted mathematically as a requirement for application of the regularized Boolean subtraction operation.
the derived_from specifies the role of the for the Thermal_isolation_laminate_component.
An Unrouted_conductive_interconnect_element is a type of . The data provided by Unrouted_conductive_interconnect_element is provided to identify an unrouted portion of a .

ext_description.p: A Via is a type of . A Via is one of a , a , or an . Via is defined in IEC 60050-541.
ext_description.example: Figure illustrates a padstack that contains a Via.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the derived_from specifies the role of the for the Via.

ext_description.p: A Via_terminal is a type of . A Via_terminal is associated with the larger diameter wall of the Via that geometrically approximates a hollow cylinder with some thickness.
ext_description.note: Since the Via itself is not allowed to interface to an item external to the interconnect, there is no concept of a join or interface terminal associated with a Via. The Via_terminal is collocated with and congruent with the entire external wall of the cylinder and may be fastened to as often as necessary.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the associated_component specifies the role of the for the Via_terminal.
the definition specifies the role of the for the Via_terminal.
An Unsupported_passage is a type of that has no metallization in the realization of its walls.
the derived_from specifies the role of the for the Unsupported_passage.
